speech.words: Hello.  My name is Robert.
We are going to listen to a great story
But before we start, I need a bit of information. A question for an adult. Please tell me your name
Hello |adultname|.  Nice to meet you!
Now, could you tell me the name of the child who will be taking part?
Hello |childname|. Nice to meet you too!
We are nearly ready.
First |adultname|, you need to decide if you want me to read the story, or if you would like to read it instead
If you would like me to read, then just say. Robert. But if instead you want to read, say. I will read
Great. I am going to tell you a story all about Jack and the Beanstalk
If you want to take over, then when you hear this noise
Then please just say.  I will read.
OK let's start
Once upon a time there was a boy called Jack. He lived with his mother.  They were very poor
All they had was a Cow.  One morning, Jack's mother told Jack to take the cow to the market and sell her
When Jack got to the market, he felt nervous
There are not many animals in the market at the moment
Can you name some farm animals?
Great. You have decided to read.
If you decide later that you want me to take over, then when you hear this noise
Then please just say.  Robert.
When you are ready, you can start
There are not many animals in the market at the moment
Can you name some farm animals?
Lovely, that is much better! Full of animals
Jack was unable to sell his cow at the market.
He was feeling hungry and wondering what his mum would think
Suddenly Jack met a strange man with twinkly eyes.
The man wanted Daisy and says he will give Jack some magic beans for the cow.
Herm. Do you think you would swap the cow for the beans?
Well that is good.  I think it sounds like a pretty good deal.
Do you think you could help me count out the beans for the cow?
Well neither would I.
I love cows.  I collect cows.  I have a drawer full of cows in my bedroom.  And one in my car.
What would you accept instead?
Open your hands to collect five beans
Here we go.
One bean
Two beans
Three beans
Oh.  A bee.
Get away, get away!
Oh. I have lost count.  How many more beans do I need to give you?
Ok I will ask for |thing:,| from the man instead
I am sure it will be fine.  Maybe I'll also ask for the beans.
Could you help me swap the beans for the cow?
Ok.  Not to worry.  I will collect the beans from the man myself
One bean
Two beans
Three beans.
Oh.
I have been distracted by the cow.
How many more beans do I need to collect?
Thanks!
I am so glad that you listened!  Let's get back to the story!
I am not sure that |mathsanswer:,| is the correct answer, sorry
I need to give you five beans but I think I have only given you three
How many beans should I give you?
Jack took the beans and went back home.
When Jack’s mother saw the beans she was very angry.
She threw the beans out of the window.
The next morning, Jack looked out of the window. There was a giant bean stalk.
Wow that is a big bean stalk.  It is taller than two houses and it would probably take an hour to walk around.
Seeing that beanstalk makes me quite jealous.  I would quite like one myself.
Could you draw a picture of the bean stalk for me?
Wow that is a big beanstalk.  It is taller than two houses and it would probably take an hour to walk around.
Seeing that beanstalk makes me quite jealous.  I would quite like one myself.
Could you draw a picture of the beanstalk for me?
Lovely, say done when you are finished
That’s fine.  Maybe later. What should Jack do now?  Should he chop it down.  Or climb it.  Or maybe just ignore it and hope it goes away. What do you think? Chop, climb or ignore?
Guess you're drawing.  Please say done when you are finished
Brilliant! What should Jack do with the beanstalk now?  Should he chop it down?  Or climb it?  Or maybe just ignore it and hope it goes away? What do you think? Chop, climb or ignore?
Great idea.  Let's chop the bean stalk down.
Oh.  But we don't have an axe.  Let's climb the bean stalk first.  Maybe we will find an axe at the top
I think that is a good idea.  Let's climb the bean stalk.
It is quite high so don't look down.  Or up.
I think ignoring it is a lovely idea.  But it just seems to keep growing.  So before we ignore it, let's climb it.
let's get back to the story!
He went outside and started to climb the beanstalk.
He climbed up to the sky through the clouds.  Jack saw a beautiful castle.  He went inside.
Jack heard a voice.
Fee, Thigh, Foe, Thumb
He ran into a cupboard
An enormous giant came into the room and sat down.  On the table there was a Hen. And a golden harp.
The giant said. Lay. And the hen laid an egg
Jack could not believe his eyes.  It was made of gold
The harp was magic too.  And it immediately noticed Jack
Ah, little boy
It said
If you don't want me to tell the giant that you are here.  You must help me write an amazing new poem that I can play later on
Let me start
Here is a giant, look where he's sat
He is playing the harp.  Next to a
What word can I use that rhymes with sat?
CAT you say.  Very good! Let's give it a go
Here is a giant, look where he's sat
He is playing the harp, and stroking his CAT
It sits there quietly on the Giant’s KNEE,
What word rhymes with KNEE that I could use?
A HAT.  That's great.  I like that a lot
Here is a giant, look where he's sat
He's playing a harp in a very fine HAT
The hat is beautiful, everyone can SEE
Stitched in the front is the letter
OK, what letter can I use that rhymes with SEE?
MAT you say.  Very good! Let's try that
Here is a giant, look where he's sat
Playing a harp on a luxurious mat
It's so soft and comfy, he digs in his FEET
The only thing that would make it better would be
I need your help, please give me a word that rhymes with FEET
A creepy BAT you say.  Very good! Let's try it.
Here is a giant, look where he's sat
Playing a harp upside down, like a BAT
His hair is all tangled and his face has gone red
OK, what can I use that rhymes with RED?
RAT you say.  Very good! Although I hate rats.  But lets try it
Here is a giant, look where he's sat
He's playing the harp, unaware that a RAT
Has snuck up behind him and I think he MIGHT
OK I need a word that rhymes with MIGHT.  Can you help?
Nice.  Here is what we have so far
Here is a giant, look where he's sat
He's playing a harp in a very fine HAT
The hat is beautiful, everyone can SEE
Stitched in the front is the letter B
Why the letter B I hear it SAID.
It is very odd, because his name is
Can you give me a name that rhymes with said?
